topic.title: Configuring the Logging Level for Services

body.p: When it is necessary to increase or decrease the logging levels for specific services, use the steps in this topic.
To configure the logging level for a specific service:

entry.note:
Other options include:
DEBUG
WARN
ERROR

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Open the following file: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/barbican/barbican_deploy_config.yml
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceilometer-reconfigure.yml

row.entry: ceilometer-alarm-evaluator-jsonThis alarm functionality has been disabled.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Ceilometer service component logging can be changed by modifying the following file: ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/_CEI-CMN/defaults/main.ymlYou can also change the log level for individual Ceilometer components by changing one or more of the files below:~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/CEI-API/templates/api-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/CEI-COL/templates/collector-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/CEI-NAG/templates/agent-notification-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/CEI-CAG/templates/agent-central-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/CEI-EXP/templates/expirer-logging.conf.j2
To change the logging level, change from CRITICAL to DEBUG on the following line: ceilometer_loglevel: INFO ceilometer_logstash_loglevel: INFO
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceilometer-reconfigure.yml

sectiondiv.p: To change the logging level, follow these steps:

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Ceph service component logging can be changed by modifying the following file: ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/_CEP-CMN/defaults/main.yml

To change the logging level, change from CRITICAL to DEBUG on the following line: ceph_mon_log_level: "{{ helion_loglevel | default('DEBUG') }}" ceph_osd_log_level: "{{ helion_loglevel | default('CRITICAL') }}" ceph_rgw_log_level: "{{ helion_loglevel | default('CRITICAL') }}"
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-reconfigure.yml
Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Cinder service component logging can be changed by modifying the following file: ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/_CND-CMN/defaults/main.yml
To change the logging level, change from INFO to DEBUG on the following line: cinder_default_loglevel: DEBUG
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml
Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Change to the following directory: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/designate
Open the configuration file for the subcomponent that you want to modify.
To change the logging level, modify the "INFO" setting following lines: designate_loglevel: {{helion_loglevel | default('INFO')}}
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts designate-reconfigure.yml
See EON Logging for more details.

sectiondiv.note: Currently the freezer service does not support debug logs.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Glance service component logging can be changed by modifying the following files: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/glance/glance-api-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/my_cloud/config/glance/glance-registry-logging.conf.j2
To change the logging level, change INFO to DEBUG on the following line: level: INFO
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml

Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts glance-reconfigure.yml
Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Heat service component logging can be changed by modifying the following files: ~/helion/my_cloud/config/heat/api-cfn-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/my_cloud/config/heat/api-cloudwatch-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/my_cloud/config/heat/api-logging.conf.j2 ~/helion/my_cloud/config/heat/engine-logging.conf.j2
Users can edit these files and set the desired log level for both local as well as centralized logging.
To change the logging level, change from WARNING to DEBUG on the following line: level: WARNING
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts heat-reconfigure.yml

sectiondiv.note: All Monasca logging is defaulted to WARN. This should provide enough information in the log files to pinpoint any issues. If you wish to provide more details, you can change the logging level to INFO level. It is recommended to avoid using the DEBUG level as that will put high stress on the controller nodes and could overload the system.
sectiondiv.p: For individual Monasca components, each of the following files will have the variable that you can set to the desired level. You do not need to edit all of the files, only the ones you want to modify.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Monitoring service component logging can be changed by modifying the following files: ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-persister/defaults/main.yml ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/zookeeper/defaults/main.yml ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/storm/defaults/main.yml ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-notification/defaults/main.yml ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-api/defaults/main.yml ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/kafka/defaults/main.yml ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-agent/defaults/main.yml (For this file, you will need to add the variable)
To change the logging level, change INFO to DEBUG on the following line: monasca_log_level: WARN
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-reconfigure.yml
Update the monasca-agent with this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-agent-reconfigure.yml

To change the logging level, change from INFO to DEBUG on the following line: level: INFO
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml

Complete the changes by running this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts neutron-reconfigure.yml
